actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

official_title: To amend the Trade Agreements Act of 1979 to authorize the United States Trade Representative to rescind any waiver of requirements of the Buy American Act with respect to products purchased from foreign countries that discriminate against certain domestically produced products.

summary.text: Amends the Trade Agreements Act of 1979 to authorize the United States Trade Representative (USTR) to rescind any waiver of the procurement of American materials requirements of the Buy American Act if he or she determines that a foreign country has violated any agreement that waives such requirements by discriminating against a U.S. product that is covered by such agreement. Requires the USTR to report to the Congress on the amount of purchases from foreign entities in which such requirements were waived in FY 1992 and 1993.

titles.title: To amend the Trade Agreements Act of 1979 to authorize the United States Trade Representative to rescind any waiver of requirements of the Buy American Act with respect to products purchased from foreign countries that discriminate against certain domestically produced products.
